greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Self-inverse permutation of nonnegative integers: a(n) = A263272(A263273(A263272(n))).
comment: A263273 conjugated with the permutation obtained from its even bisection.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..6561
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: As a composition of related permutations:
A000035(a(n)) = A000035(n). [This permutation preserves the parity of n.]
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{g, h}, g[x_] := x/3^IntegerExponent[x, 3]; h[x_] := x/g@ x; If[n == 0, 0, FromDigits[Reverse@ IntegerDigits[#, 3], 3] &@g[n] h[n]]]; t = Table[f[2 n]/2, {n, 0, 1000}]; Table[t[[f[t[[n + 1]]] + 1]], {n, 0, 83}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jan 04 2016, after _Jean-François Alcover_ at A263273 *)
program: def a030102(n): return 0 if n==0 else int(''.join(map(str, digits(n, 3)[1:][::-1])), 3)
return 1 if n==1 else reduce(mul, [1 if i==3 else i**f[i] for i in f])
def a(n): return a263272(a263273(a263272(n))) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 25 2017
xref: Cf. A265369, A266190, A266401, A266403 (other conjugates or similar derivations of A263273).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 02 2016
